message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the properties of magnets. When two decorative items for a refrigerator, which are likely magnets, are placed back to back, they will not touch because they have opposite poles and therefore repel each other. Option (B) is incorrect because they will not stick together. Option (C) is incorrect because they will not be sticky. Option (D) is incorrect because they will not be charged, as this refers to the buildup of electric charge and not magnetic properties.

This question requires some basic knowledge about magnetic forces. When two decorative items for a refrigerator are placed back to back, they will not stick together or be sticky. This is because most decorative items for refrigerators are made of non-magnetic materials such as plastic or paper. Option (B) is incorrect because there is no magnetic force to cause them to stick together. Option (C) is incorrect because there is no sticky substance involved. Option (D) is incorrect because there is no electrical charge involved. Therefore, option (A) is the correct answer.

This question involves understanding the properties of magnets. When two decorative items for a refrigerator are placed back to back, if they are magnetic, they will repel each other and refuse to touch. This phenomenon occurs because magnets have two poles, North and South, and like poles repel each other. Option (B) is incorrect because magnets do not stick together when their like poles are facing each other. Option (C) is incorrect because stickiness does not relate to the interaction between magnets. Option (D) is incorrect because being charged refers to an electrical state and is not related to magnets.

When two decorative items, such as magnets, are placed back to back, they will refuse to touch each other because they have opposite magnetic polarities. Similar poles of magnets repel each other, causing the items to push away from each other. Option (B) is incorrect because magnets do not stick together when placed back to back. Option (C) is also incorrect because stickiness is not a property of magnets. Option (D) is incorrect because being charged is also not related to the behavior of magnets.
